San_Clemente.San Onofre Nuclear Generating Station:
The San Onofre Nuclear Generating Station (SONGS) is a now permanently-closed nuclear power plant located on the Pacific coast of California, in the northwestern corner of San Diego County, south of San Clemente, and situated in Nuclear Regulatory Commission Region IV. The plant is currently in preparation to be decommissioned after being shut down in 2013 following the failure of replacement steam generators.
The nuclear facility is owned by Southern California Edison. Edison International, parent of SCE, holds 78.2% ownership in the plant; San Diego Gas & Electric Company, 20%; and the City of Riverside Utilities Department, 1.8%.
